verbose_text: Together with the observation that ENG binds BMP9 with comparable affinity to ALK1 but is significantly more abundant than the type I receptor in endothelial cells, these findings support a model where homodimeric BMP9 is first efficiently captured and retained on the surface of endothelial cells by the bivalent architecture of ENG, and a ternary complex is then formed upon non competitive recruitment of ALK1 (XREF_FIG A-5C).
evidence: ENG binds BMP9 with comparable affinity to ALK1
